title:
Exceptional sets for length under restricted families of projections
  onto lines in $\mathbb{R}^3$
abstract:
It is shown that if $A \subseteq \mathbb{R}^3$ is a Borel set of Hausdorff
dimension $\dim A>1$, and if $\rho_{\theta}$ is orthogonal projection to the
line spanned by $( \cos \theta, \sin \theta, 1 )$, then $\rho_{\theta}(A)$ has
positive length for all $\theta$ outside a set of Hausdorff dimension at most
$\frac{3-\dim A}{2}$.
